page.title: 10THORNHILL PETS
page.content: The two most common pets in Thornhill, as in the whole country,are dogs and cats.Most people have either a dog or cat or even both.However,two families keep goats.One of these has 3 female or nanny goats.Sometimes the milk is sold for medicinal purposes-it is used to help some skin troubles.The kids when born ,are usually given away.Most farmers'children have a pony because they have the proper facilities and grazing for them.Other people keep mice,hamsters or even"simple to keep goldfish".Two people in the village own ferrets which they use to catch rabbits.Another of our pet favourites is the budgie and the rabbit because you don't have to take them for walks.
